author: RAC
title: La construcciÃ³n intensifica la busca de trabajadores forÃ¡neos
text:
La construcciÃ³n intensifica la busca de trabajadores forÃ¡neos
Las jubilaciones y la fuga de talento agravan el dÃ©ficit de mano de obra
El presidente de la FederaciÃ³n Gallega de la ConstrucciÃ³n y de los empresarios del sector en la provincia de A CoruÃ±a (Apecco), Diego VÃ¡zquez Reino, apelÃ³ ayer a captar Â«talentoÂ» y atraer mano de obra para afrontar el reto de poner en el mercado vivienda, mientras que rechazÃ³ riesgo de una burbuja inmobiliaria. Durante un almuerzo organizado por Apecco en A CoruÃ±a, VÃ¡zquez Reino destacÃ³ que las perspectivas en cuanto a la construcciÃ³n de vivienda son Â«halagÃ¼eÃ±as y esperanzadorasÂ».
Tras incidir en el Â«gran retoÂ» en vivienda que existe en el paÃ­s, advirtiÃ³ de que debe abordarse la captaciÃ³n de talento y mano de obra. En este sentido, detallÃ³ iniciativas para Â«recuperarÂ» profesionales que emigraron a otros puntos de EspaÃ±a, pero tambiÃ©n puso el punto de mira en los trabajadores extranjeros o Â«atraer a jÃ³venes y mujeresÂ». El volumen de profesionales que se jubilarÃ¡n en los prÃ³ximos aÃ±os asÃ­ lo exigen: unos Â«10.000 trabajadoresÂ» de la industria constructiva.
Por su parte, el delegado del Gobierno, Pedro Blanco, reivindicÃ³ las actuaciones del Ejecutivo central en materia de infraestructuras y construcciÃ³n, Â«trabajando en todas las grandes villas y Ã¡reas metropolitanasÂ». En su intervenciÃ³n, expuso que el Gobierno ha movilizado una inversiÃ³n de 3.665 millones en obra pÃºblica y detallÃ³ que el alcance de esta inversiÃ³n repercute Â«directamenteÂ» en el 53% por ciento de la poblaciÃ³n e indirectamente en su totalidad.

author: J. F.
title: Un proyecto educativo dotarÃ¡ a personas mayores, escolares y futuros periodistas de herramientas para combatir la desinformaciÃ³n | El Diario Vasco
text:
Compartir En un panorama mediÃ¡tico cada vez mÃ¡s complejo y saturado de informaciÃ³n, el Centro de Inteligencia Digital de la Provincia de Alicante (CENID) ha lanzado un ambicioso proyecto de alfabetizaciÃ³n mediÃ¡tica para combatir la desinformaciÃ³n, las noticias falsas y la polarizaciÃ³n. Esta iniciativa, denominada AlfabetizaciÃ³n MediÃ¡tica Glocal, estÃ¡ liderada por el profesor del Ãrea de Periodismo de la Universidad Miguel HernÃ¡ndez, JosÃ© Luis GonzÃ¡lez Esteban, quien la equipara a campaÃ±as de salud pÃºblica en su relevancia para la ciudadanÃ­a.
El ecosistema mediÃ¡tico actual presenta desafÃ­os significativos como la desinformaciÃ³n, las campaÃ±as de desprestigio y la inseguridad digital, amenazando los sistemas democrÃ¡ticos a nivel global. La democratizaciÃ³n del acceso a la informaciÃ³n que trajo internet ha evolucionado hacia un espacio donde los algoritmos han perfeccionado la manipulaciÃ³n, desviando la atenciÃ³n de medios profesionales hacia canales que buscan intereses espurios y transmiten informaciones falsas.
Frente a esta realidad, la alfabetizaciÃ³n mediÃ¡tica se erige como la Â«vacunaÂ» contra la desinformaciÃ³n, segÃºn informa el portal Nova Ciencia . El proyecto del CENID busca formar a personas mayores, escolares y estudiantes de comunicaciÃ³n de la provincia de Alicante en el consumo saludable de la informaciÃ³n. El objetivo es que estos grupos aprendan a reconocer noticias falsas, a utilizar herramientas de verificaciÃ³n y a desenvolverse con soltura en el complejo entorno de los medios y las redes sociales.
JosÃ© Luis GonzÃ¡lez Esteban subraya la necesidad de educar en hÃ¡bitos de comunicaciÃ³n saludables desde edades tempranas. Su enfoque se centra en dotar a la poblaciÃ³n de las herramientas necesarias para mantener una posiciÃ³n crÃ­tica ante la informaciÃ³n que reciben a travÃ©s de sus telÃ©fonos, redes sociales o medios de comunicaciÃ³n, reconociendo que estos Ãºltimos tambiÃ©n pueden cometer errores o responder a intereses de poder. En los talleres, se enseÃ±a a los participantes a manejar verificadores y a cuestionar la informaciÃ³n dudosa.
Una caracterÃ­stica distintiva de esta iniciativa es la participaciÃ³n de periodistas iberoamericanos que han sufrido violencia y amenazas debido a su labor informativa en sus paÃ­ses de origen.
La atenciÃ³n y el pensamiento crÃ­tico AdemÃ¡s, el proyecto aborda el efecto de los algoritmos sobre la atenciÃ³n de los usuarios de las redes sociales. Los expertos explican cÃ³mo estos canales estÃ¡n diseÃ±ados para captar la atenciÃ³n de manera adictiva, generando dopamina y haciendo que Â«el pensamiento crÃ­tico muera en el procesoÂ». Este anÃ¡lisis se realiza desde un punto de vista crÃ­tico y cientÃ­fico, tambiÃ©n cubriendo temas como el impacto de la inteligencia artificial en la comunicaciÃ³n y la ciberseguridad en las democracias.
Newsletter Finalmente, con especial Ã©nfasis en los estudiantes de Periodismo, el proyecto busca sentar las bases para el fortalecimiento de un periodismo libre. JosÃ© Luis GonzÃ¡lez Esteban defiende en declaraciones a Nova Ciencia un periodismo que vuelva a la calle, recupere la conversaciÃ³n y use la inteligencia artificial como una herramienta complementaria, no como el nÃºcleo de la labor informativa.

author: IANS
title: Sikh mother, son jailed in UK for conspiring to steal from community wedding fund - Investing.com India
text:
London, Dec 24 (IANS) A Sikh mother and son have been sentenced to a total prison term of more than three years in the UK for conspiring to steal 8000 pounds from a community wedding fund.
Kalwant Kaur, 41, was jailed for 15 months and Jung Singh Lankanpal, 22, was handed a 30-month jail term as they appeared before the Southampton Crown Court on Friday.
A court heard a group of women from the local Sikh community had helped organise a collection to pay for a wedding within the community.
While they were counting the money, Lankanpal, armed with a gun, burst inside the property at Clovelly Road in Southampton on September 15.
He threatened the women and demanded they hand over the money, the Hampshire Police said in a statement.
The court heard that the vehicle used to get away from the scene, a red Hyundai, was found to be registered in the name of Kaur who was at the address and helping with the collection.
"Kaur and Lankanpal made a cold and callous decision to steal such a large sum of money from people they knew, money which was meant to help people in their community," Detective Constable Jess Swift, from the Western Area Crime Team, said.
"Despite Kaur trying to present herself as a witness to a crime, it was quickly established she had used her knowledge to help orchestrate this burglary," Swift added.
Both mother and son were arrested the same day they committed the crime, and pleaded guilty in October to a charge of conspiring to commit a burglary.
"Through some very comprehensive enquiries, we have been able to ensure both pleaded guilty to these offences and will serve a jail sentence. I hope this provides the local community some reassurance and gives them some justice for what happened," Swift said.
--IANS

author: Dylan Terry
title: Watch Lewis Hamiltonâ€™s potential successor Antonelli fail Mercedes audition with HUGE blunder in Italian GP practice
text:
LEWIS HAMILTON'S potential successor Andrea Kimi Antonelli suffered a huge crash in the Mercedes car during a practice session at the Italian Grand Prix.
Italian
Antonelli, 18, is on the verge of being announced as George Russell's team-mate next year after impressing in the Silver Arrows' junior set-up.
Mercedes boss Toto Wolff confirmed earlier this month
Max Verstappen will not be signing for them next year, leaving the door open for the young prodigy.
But
Antonelli's bid to seal his seat suffered a massive blow on Friday afternoon when he crashed during his stint in the first practice session at Monza.
He spun out just 10 minutes into P1 and crashed into the wall as a red flag was waved.
Antonelli got out of the car and walked away seemingly unscathed after apologising to the team on the radio.
READ MORE IN F1
In response,
Wolff replied: "Kimi, all good. All good, Kimi."
Antonelli, who has been with Mercedes since he was 11 years of age, was touted as one of a number of candidates to replace
Hamilton after the seven-time champion announced he would be joining Ferrari in 2025.
Driving the Mercedes car in front of his home fans will have been a special moment for the teenager.
And Wolff said: "Qualifying with Kimi in Monza will be emotional because we have followed him since he was 11.
Most read in Motorsport
CASINO SPECIAL - BEST CASINO WELCOME OFFERS
ðŸ Complete
F1 2024 race calendar - details on every Grand Prix and start time this year ðŸ
"Having an Italian kid in a competitive car, everybody in Italy can be proud."
Antonelli began karting at the age of just seven and won the CIK-FIA Karting European Champion in both 2020 and 2021.
He then made his debut in single-seaters for Prema Racing in the Italian F4 Championship three weeks after turning 15.
He has a number of wins to his name in F4, along with the 2023 Formula Regional European Championship.
Antonelli is also currently contesting the Formula 2 Championship for Prema.
Wolff has said of him: "Since working together, Kimi has ticked all the boxes.
Read More on The US Sun
"But not only that, I really like him as a boy, and as a personality, and he has a fantastic family environment around him that helps him always keep his feet on the ground.
"He has a great talent and can count on the important values that come from his family."
